DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: BLAWID, S.;BLAWID, S;Blawid, Stefan;BLAWID, STEFAN MICHAEL

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Stefan Blawid was born in Berlin, Germany. He received his Dipl.-Phys. degree from the Freie Universität Berlin in 1993 and his Ph.D. in Theoretical Physics from the Max-Planck-Institut für Physik komplexer Systeme, Dresden, Germany, in 1997, both with distinction. Awarded with a fellowship from the German Research Foundation he concluded his postdoctoral education at Rutgers University, New Jersey, USA, where he worked on charge ordering in rare-earth manganites from 1999 to 2001. Stefan Blawid has extensive working experience both in academia (Associate Lecturer at TU Braunschweig, 2001 - 2004, Interim Professor at TU Dresden, 2009-2010, Tenured Professor at UnB 2011-2019) as well as in semiconductor industry (Senior TCAD Expert at the memory company Qimonda, 2004 - 2009). He has published mainly about novel electronic states and devices. He applied for several patents on lithographic processes. Since 2019, Stefan Blawid is a Professor for Computer Engineering at the Universidade Federal de Pernambuco. His scientific activities focus currently on Computational Electronics, Quantum Information and Printed Organic Electronics. He acted as consultant for industrial partners in the area of TCAD, DFM and modeling (with focus on computational optical lithography including OPC, RET, mask design, alignment modeling and statistical process control).

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Compact modeling and characterization of carbon nanotube field-effect transistors and analog high-frequency circuit design
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Carbon nanotube field-effect transistors (CNTFETs) are an attractive technology for high-speed analog device applications due to their high intrinsic mobility and very low capacitance per tube. First high-frequency devices with moderate layout dimensions and multiple tubes within the channel may soon be available commercially. However, to explore the unique features of carbon nanotube technology in applications a physics based and geometry scalable compact model is urgently needed to enable circuit design and performance optimization. Deriving, experimentally verifying, and implementing such a model for manufacturable CNTFETs is the main goal of the present project. To achieve this goal, fabricated advanced CNTFETs will be extensively characterized experimentally (both small- and large-signal) and results of an existing device simulation infrastructure will be used as a starting point for the compact model development. As prerequisite, a collaboration with an industrial partner has been established that provides access to GHz CNTFETs from a stepper-based fabrication. The present project will bridge the presently existing gap between basic research (physics, chemistry) and practical applications (electrical engineering) by developing device modeling and simulation capabilities that are suitable for investigating the actual potential of CNTFETs in high-frequency analog circuits.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Compact modeling and characterization of carbon nanotube field-effect transistors and analog high-frequency circuit design

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: High-frequency modeling and characterization of printed organic crystalline transistors
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: From an application point of view, organic devices are often considered too slow for wireless applications due to their low mobilities and related low transit frequencies. On the other hand, organic materials allow fabrication on flexible plastic substrates at moderate fabrication costs with a high throughput. Very recent advances in fabrication of single crystalline films have lead to very high mobilities which, for carefully designed transistor architectures, will push the transit frequencies to values which meet the requirements of wireless applications. In addition, by exploiting the non-quasi-static operation regime of the transistors, circuits operating at tens, hundreds of MHz or even GHz become feasible. With the progress in organic electronics made over the last years, the demand for adequate modeling support beyond the quasi-static approximation thus increases.This project aims to develop and provide device models for organic single crystalline thin films which enable device optimization and circuit design for high-frequency and non-quasi-static operation. A tight collaboration between model development and experimental studies ensures a careful model verification and calibration as well as experimental proof-of-concepts for high-frequency transistor and circuit operation.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: High-frequency modeling and characterization of printed organic crystalline transistors

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Dispositivos orgânicos para marcas impressas de identificação em radiofrequência
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Printed electronics i.e. the deposition of organic semiconductors on flexible substrates with low-cost printing techniques will in near future complement microelectronics based on crystalline semiconductors. Radio frequency identification (RFID) as used e.g. in employee badges, event access tickets or in the supply chain (including livestock identification) is doubtless an important target market for printed electronics. However, characteristically low transistor switching frequencies and associated high supply voltages are the main obstacles for printed electronics. Therefore, the development of suitable printable inks for manufacturing the different electronic device layers (conducting, semiconducting or dielectric) remains the main challenge. The given project will evaluate the potential of polymers naturally occurring in Brazil as printable inks like the organic compound blends found in oils. In contrast to pure materials research which tends to focus on improving single material properties like the charge carrier mobility the given project employs a true engineering approach drawing on all core competencies available at the Laboratório de Dispositivos e Circuitos Integrados (LDCI) at the University of Brasília. Material specifications will be ultimately derived from RFID circuit design, which is linked to the manufacturing technology via device modeling and simulation. To this extent, simple devices like transistor, inverter, ring oscillator and rectifier will be printed employing an off-the-shelf thermal inkjet printer and thoroughly characterized both physically and electrically.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Dispositivos orgânicos para marcas impressas de identificação em radiofrequência

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Instituto Nacional de Ciência e Tecnologia de Sistemas Micro e Nanoletrônicos (Phase III)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The NAMITEC National Institute of Science and Technology is aimed at advancing the research and development of intelligent micro- and nano-electromechanical systems for use in sensor networks and embedded and self-adjusted systems, among others. Applications include precision agriculture, environmental protection, energy processing, biomedical instrumentation, automotive and aerospace industries, and telecommunications. Within this context, the main goals of this project are the research and development of (a) systems-on-chip and sensor networks, (b) design/test methodology and EDA tools for low-power and fault tolerant analog, RF, and digital integrated circuits, (c) micro- and nano-electromechanical, photo- and optoelectronic devices as well as integration and packaging processes for MEMS and NEMS, (d) materials and processes for the fabrication of micro- and nano-integrated devices and circuits.

Phase III: Na linha A.2 (Projetos de CI): Simulação de transistores de efeito-campo de nanotubos de carbono para aplicações analógicas; Na linha A.4 (Dispositivos semicondutores): Modelagem do transporte em materiais orgânicos (OFETs) e Projeto auxiliado por computador para a tecnologia de OLEDs
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Instituto Nacional de Ciência e Tecnologia de Sistemas Micro e Nanoletrônicos (Phase III)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Simulação Multiescala de Eletrônica de Carbono (MuSiCaEl) - Bolsa PQ - 2018
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto proposto desenvolverá ferramentas de TCAD e EDA para permitir a simulação da eletrônica de carbono desde o nível de material até o nível de sistema. O ambiente de simulação em múltiplas escalas permitirá derivar especificações de dispositivos semicondutores dos requisitos do sistema. Além disso, algumas limitações de desempenho intrínsecas de dispositivos emergentes exigem novas formas de processamentos de informações como computação aproximada ou neuromórfica. Tais conceitos só podem ser testados com um software multiescala disponível.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: NAnoPiE - Modeling of 1d pi-conjugated nano structures for analog electronics
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Objectives: (i) Fabrication: (O1.1) Establish DPN capabilites at LDCI, (O1.2) Write successfully nanowires of conducting polymers with sub #956;m width, (O1.3) Access the possibility to integrate organic nanowires as active channel material in the process flow currently developed at LDCI to manufacture all-printed organic FETs, (O1.4) Pattern successfully CNT growth positions employing DPN; (ii) Modeling: (O2.1) Build successfully a simulation infrastructure of organic pi-conjugated nano structures and simulate benchmark devices, (O2.2) Provide optimized device architectures for organic pi-conjugated nanostructures based on numerical device simulations, (O2.3) Develop and verify compact models for active transistors and passive devices such as resistors, capacitors and inductors, (O2.4) Implement these compact models in Verilog-A for the use in circuit simulators; (iii) Characterization: (O3.1) Setting up the various systems for the experimental characterization of the temperature dependent device behavior and S-parameter measurements and demonstrate the measurement capabilities by the experimental characterization of first prototype devices, (O3.2) Evaluate experimentally the device performance and provide experimental results for the calibration of the numerical device simulator and for the verification of the developed compact models, (O3.3) Evaluate the necessity to extend the device characterization techniques at LDCI.(iv) Circuit Design: (O4.1) Benchmark 1D analog electronics based on organic pi-conjugated semiconductors with various emerging and incumbent technologies;(v) Accompanying activities

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Projeto: Crystallization dynamics of thermally annealed natural dyes embedded in polymeric matrices for trap-reduced organic photonic devices

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Crystallization dynamics of thermally annealed natural dyes embedded in polymeric matrices for trap-reduced organic photonic devices
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Project proposal 20170782 approved by the LNLS PROGRAM COMMITEE. Blending organic semiconductors with large-bandgap compounds may present a cost efficient strategy to reduce the impact of traps in photonic devices. In the present proposal, the crystallization dynamics of blends of the synthetic polymeric organic semiconductor P3HT as well as blends of natural dyes with different diluting host matrices shall be investigated. Natural dyes present a ''green'' alternative to synthetic polymers, which often need to be processed employing hazardous halogenated solvents. The formation of crystalline islands and percolation pathways of the economical important natural red and yellow dyes bixin and curcumin will be quantified and compared to the crystallization dynamics of pure polymeric blends.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Crystallization dynamics of thermally annealed natural dyes embedded in polymeric matrices for trap-reduced organic photonic devices

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Project approved for a MICROSOFT AI FOR EARTH GRANT. Our project aims to offer family farmers an easy and fast way to diagnose diseases (be it viruses, fungi, or bacteria) in their crops through a photo taken with a smartphone camera. It makes use of an AI thats able to classify the kind of disease in a leaf or fruit image, allowing such farmers to quickly take action in order to treat such diseases.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Avaliação comparativa de tecnologias emergentes para computação próxima e dentro de sensores (BEeTle) - Bolsa PQ - 2021
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O desejo de entregar em qualquer lugar e sob demanda sistemas sensoriais de baixo custo em substratos mecanicamente flexíveis também impulsiona a tecnologia. Atualmente, a eletrônica híbrida flexível (FHE) é o candidato mais promissor. Parte desse sistema é impressa, incluindo sensores, circuitos de baixo nível, antenas, módulos de coleta e armazenamento de energia. No entanto, o desempenho necessário para computação de alto nível e comunicação de alta frequência é fornecido por CIs de silício afinados. A eletrônica impressa é alimentada por novos materiais como alótropos de carbono. Alguns desses materiais possuem propriedades eletrônicas, térmicas e mecânicas que superam as do silício. Novos materiais de alto desempenho e técnicas de fabricação, portanto, podem ser explorados não apenas para eletrônicos impressos, mas também para tarefas adicionais em FHE, como coprocessadores baseados em redes neurais artificiais ou tecidos de alta densidade de lógica reconfigurável no nível do transistor. Como qualquer tecnologia emergente, o FHE ainda está em sua infância e não pode contar com a mesma sofisticação das ferramentas de automação de design (EDA) e projeto auxiliado por computador (TCAD). O projeto proposto irá desenvolver ferramentas TCAD e EDA para permitir a simulação e {\it benchmarking} de circuitos FHE representativos para computação em sensor e próximo a ele.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Aprendizado de Máquina Minúscula para Sensores Agrícolas Inteligentes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto apoiado por recursos internos do CIN e pela FACEPE (Bolsa IBPG-0992-1.03/22). O projeto deve avaliar o valor de sensores de baixo custo combinados com modelos locais de aprendizado de máquina (ML) para agricultura de precisão em uma estufa. Especificamente, o projeto irá (i) desenvolver sensores inteligentes para monitorar a saúde, crescimento e estresse hídrico das plantas; (ii) Treinar pequenos modelos de ML; (iii) Estabelecer transmissão de dados com base no protocolo LoRa para um banco de dados em nuvem em tempo real; (iv) Implantar o sistema de sensores em uma estufa.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de um pipeline fitossanitário impulsionado pelo aprendizado de máquina para detecção de vírus de plantas em dados de sequenciamento de alto rendimento (APPLVD)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projecto aprovado na CHAMADA CNPQ/AWS NO 64/2022. O projeto visa avaliar a diversidade viral em cultivos de mandioca e inhame em Pernambuco por meio da coleta de amostras de sequenciamento de alto rendimento. Desenvolveremos software de aprendizado de máquina, incluindo classificadores, montadores e algoritmos de categorização, para analisar as populações virais identificadas. Além disso, serão definidas estratégias para gerenciar o ciclo de vida dos modelos pela comunidade de pesquisa em virologia vegetal.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Instituto de Tecnologias Quânticas da UFPE
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto aprovado na CHAMADA PÚBLICA MCTI/FINEP/FNDCT/CENTROS TEMÁTICOS 2023, na área de defesa. O objetivo central do projeto é fundar o QUANTA-UFPE, instituto dedicado às tecnologias quânticas de interesse e aplicação em defesa, especialmente para computação quântica, troca de chaves criptográficas quânticas e criptografia pós-quântica. Será realizada a montagem de um primeiro processador quântico fotônico de informação para aplicações em redes quânticas capazes de realizar protocolos tanto de comunicação quanto de computação quânticas. Para ser construído, este processador demandará a colaboração de engenheiros, físicos e cientistas da computação, sendo uma meta agregadora do know-how de todos os envolvidos no projeto. Ele será instalado no Laboratório de Computação Quântica Fotônica (LCQF) do instituto. Para sua implementação, contará com o suporte do Laboratório de Redes Quânticas e da Central Multiusuária da Física, localizados no Centro de Ciências Exatas e da Natureza (CCEN) da UFPE, e da Rede de Laboratórios de Fotônica da UFPE (FotonNetUFPE), com vários laboratórios no CCEN e no Centro deTecnologia e Geociências (CTG) da UFPE. Além do esforço coletivo para construção dessa máquina, ela demandará também desenvolvimentos teóricos específicos para guiar suas primeiras aplicações e traçar planos futuros de expansão. A atividade teórica do instituto ficará centrada no Laboratório de Computação Quântica Teórica (LCQT), que buscará articular as necessidades do nosso processador quântico com avanços na vasta fronteira teórica das tecnologias quânticas. Finalmente, será também instalado o Laboratório de Comunicação Quântica (LCOMQ) do instituto, com ligação direta à rede quântica atualmente em construção (dentro de outro projeto) entre diferentes centros da UFPE e entre UFPE e UFRPE. Nesse laboratório, pretendemos inicialmente trabalhar na conversão de informação quântica entre fótons do nosso processador quântico e fótons na banda espectral de telecomunicação, para já conectar o LCQF diretamente aos outros sítios da rede. Também implementaremos protocolos de criptografia entre os sítios instalados no QUANTA-UFPE e no CCEN e CTG. O Instituto QUANTA-UFPE será instalado no Edifício Celso Furtado, antigo prédio da SUDENE, numa área de 1000 metros quadrados. Além dos pesquisadores na equipe inicial do projeto, a esses três laboratórios estarão ainda associados bolsistas de pesquisa em diversos níveis, da graduação ao pós-doutorado, com a formação dessa nova geração de profissionais sendo um objetivo importante do projeto. FINEP - Ref. 1020/24.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Gerenciamento e acompanhamento do programa de bolsas de incentivo à inovação agropecuária nas regiões Norte e Nordeste
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto financiado por ENCOMENDA SDI-MAPA: LINHA 1 - MODERNIZAÇÃO E INOVAÇÃO NA AGROPECUÁRIA. According to Decree No. 11,332/2023, DIAGRO supports the creation and enhancement of agribusiness innovation environments, fostering open innovation and collaboration between public and private sectors, science institutions, startups, and financing agents. The initiative aims to boost connectivity in rural areas, advance digital agriculture, and stimulate agricultural bioeconomy, particularly biologically based inputs. Encouraging agricultural innovation in Brazil benefits the economy, environment, and global competitiveness. This project, executed in partnership with the National Institute of Software Engineering, focuses on managing a scholarship program for agricultural innovation in the North and Northeast regions. The goal is to strengthen state innovation ecosystems in agriculture, encompassing connectivity, digital systems, bioeconomy, and new technologies. Successful ecosystems contribute to social equity by providing small farmers access to information, markets, and resources, empowering marginalized communities. Fellows will work locally in each state, identifying leaders for state innovation ecosystems, fostering interstate integration, implementing monitoring frameworks, and showcasing each state's technological strengths. The project aligns with Brazil's potential to become a leader in modern and resilient agriculture while addressing pressing challenges like food security and climate change.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A semiconductor device comprises structure comprising part of parallel linear structures; and another structure comprising pad structures. Another structure forms part of linear structure, curved structure, piecewise linear structure and/or curved structure, and is positioned at angle with one structure such that pad structures intersect linear structure(s). Each pad structure includes rectangular or polygonal structure. The pad structures are part of staggered pattern, single and/or double sided fan-out pattern.

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Method of adjusting optical parameter of exposure apparatus involves optimizing optical model by adjusting one optical parameter so as to reduce overall difference between measured pattern data and simulated image
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The method involves performing a photolithographic projection using an exposure apparatus and using a layout pattern so as to provide measured pattern data. The optical model is provided to describe the exposure apparatus. A simulated image is created by using the optical model and the layout pattern. The optical model is optimized by adjusting the one optical parameter so as to reduce an overall difference between the measured pattern data and the simulated image for the different focus settings.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Termination structure for manufacturing e.g. dynamic RAM-chip, has extension element adjacent to line-shaped element, where longest axis of line-shaped element is three times higher than broadest width of line-shaped element

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Termination structure for manufacturing e.g. dynamic RAM-chip, has extension element adjacent to line-shaped element, where longest axis of line-shaped element is three times higher than broadest width of line-shaped element
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The structure has an extension element adjacent to a line-shaped element for partially increasing width of the line-shaped element. The termination structure is positioned on one of a group of substrate, silicon wafer and lithography mask. A longest axis of the line-shaped element is three times higher than broadest width of the line-shaped element. A semi-isolated structure partially terminates a regular line-space pattern. Multiple extension units are positioned in a periodic pattern along the line-shaped element.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Semiconductor device manufacturing method, involves providing semiconductor substrate available with surface, and layer pile comprising conductive layer on substrate surface

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Semiconductor device manufacturing method, involves providing semiconductor substrate available with surface, and layer pile comprising conductive layer on substrate surface

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The method involves providing a semiconductor substrate available with a surface, and a layer pile comprising a conductive layer on the substrate surface. The layer pile is structured so that individual conductive strips and individual land-contact surfaces are formed. Each land-contact surface is connected with a corresponding conductive strip. Lithographic exposure is done using a set of two different photomasks for structuring of layer pile. The land-contact surfaces are arranged at a side of an arrangement area which has multiple conductive strips.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Semiconductor device e.g. memory device provided with nitrided ROM memory cells, comprises carbon layer made of elemental carbon provided in contact on patterned layer, and cover layer formed on the top of carbon layer

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Semiconductor device e.g. memory device provided with nitrided ROM memory cells, comprises carbon layer made of elemental carbon provided in contact on patterned layer, and cover layer formed on the top of carbon layer
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The semiconductor device comprises a carbon layer made of elemental carbon provided in contact on a patterned layer. A cover layer is formed on the top of the carbon layer. The carbon layer includes voids in the spaces between patterns in the patterned layer.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Semiconductor device manufacture for making e.g. memory device involves patterning layer stack by performing lithographic exposures using different photomasks and arranging landing pads at side of array region defined by conductive lines

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Semiconductor device manufacture for making e.g. memory device involves patterning layer stack by performing lithographic exposures using different photomasks and arranging landing pads at side of array region defined by conductive lines
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The method involves patterning a layer stack to form a single conductive lines and single landing pads, in which each of the landing pads is connected with a corresponding conductive line. The layer stack comprises of at least one conductive layer on the surface of a semiconductor substrate. Patterning the layer stack involves performing two lithographic exposures using a set of two different photomasks. The landing pads are arranged at one side of an array region defined by the conductive lines.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Hard mask layer stack for patterning target layer in manufacture of memory device, has predetermined layer of material, selected from group which comprises silicon oxide and silicon oxinitride that is arranged on top of carbon layer

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Hard mask layer stack for patterning target layer in manufacture of memory device, has predetermined layer of material, selected from group which comprises silicon oxide and silicon oxinitride that is arranged on top of carbon layer
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.NOME-DO-DEPOSITANTE: Boubekeur, H.;Verhoeven, M.;Nagel, N.;Tatry, T.;Caspary, D.;Markert, M.;Infineon

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A carbon layer is arranged on top of a target layer to be patterned. A predetermined layer of a material, selected from a group which comprises silicon oxide and silicon oxinitride, is arranged on top of the carbon layer. A silicon layer is arranged on top of the predetermined layer.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Hard masking layer stack for use in semiconductor memory device, has carbon layer arranged on layer to be structured, and covering layer arranged on intermediate layer, where intermediate layer is thicker than covering layer

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Hard masking layer stack for use in semiconductor memory device, has carbon layer arranged on layer to be structured, and covering layer arranged on intermediate layer, where intermediate layer is thicker than covering layer

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The stack has a carbon layer that is arranged on a layer to be structured, and an intermediate layer that is arranged on the carbon layer. A covering layer is arranged on the intermediate layer, where the intermediate layer is thicker than the covering layer. A photoresistant layer is arranged in contact with the covering layer, and the carbon layer has holes in an intermediate area between structures in the layer to be structured, where the stack has a thickness larger than 100 nanometer.
